history.content:
<md>CS 280: Haven't personally taken the class, but usually there is a google form or something similar posted on classes.berkeley.edu or the piazza if you search enough. Not sure what you mean by next semester because it is being offered Spring 2022, not Fall 2021 according to the CS draft schedule. You most likely need research with a BAIR researcher or A/A+ in 189, 184, and/or 194-26 to get into CS 280

CS 288: Dan Klein will probably put out a form on classes.berkeley.edu or piazza for undergrads, but note that you might not get a code if the class fills up too fast with graduate students. This semester, the professor allowed everyone that completed P0 into the class, but I don't expect this to be reciprocated in future in person semesters. Most likely need A/A+'s in CS 188 and/or 189 to get in. 

Edit: for 288 enrollment, see @14857</md>

children.subject: I dont think you need 184 for 280 but +1 on the rest.

history.content: I am thinking of taking either CS 288 or CS 280 next semester but I am an undergrad. Is there a petition form we must fill out? Do we contact the professor?
history.subject: How to get into grad class as an undergrad?
